docs.title: AI-Powered Browser Debugging Platform
docs.text:
Welcome to RapidTriageME - a comprehensive browser debugging and triage platform that seamlessly integrates with AI assistants through the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

- :material-rocket-launch:{ .lg .middle } **Quick Start** --- Get up and running in under 5 minutes [:octicons-arrow-right-24: Getting started](getting-started/quickstart.md) - :material-book-open-variant:{ .lg .middle } **Architecture** --- Understand the system design and components [:octicons-arrow-right-24: Learn more](architecture/overview.md) - :material-api:{ .lg .middle } **API Reference** --- Complete API documentation and examples [:octicons-arrow-right-24: View APIs](api/index.md) - :material-cloud-upload:{ .lg .middle } **Deploy** --- Deploy to production with Cloudflare [:octicons-arrow-right-24: Deployment guide](deployment/cloudflare.md)

docs.title: 🎯 What is RapidTriageME?
docs.text: RapidTriageME is a powerful debugging platform that captures browser data (console logs, network requests, errors) and makes it available to AI assistants for intelligent analysis and troubleshooting.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 🔍 Real-time Browser Monitoring - Capture console logs, network requests, and errors
  • 🤖 AI Integration - Seamless integration with Claude, ChatGPT, and other AI assistants via MCP
  • 🌐 Remote Access - Debug browsers anywhere through Cloudflare Workers
  • 📸 Screenshot Capture - Visual debugging with automatic screenshot capabilities
  • 🚀 Performance Audits - Built-in Lighthouse integration for performance analysis
  • 🔒 Secure - JWT authentication and encrypted connections

docs.text:
graph TB

        CE[Chrome Extension]
        WT[Web Page]

    CE -->|WebSocket| BC

docs.title: REST API Reference
docs.text: The Browser Connector Server exposes a RESTful API for retrieving browser data and controlling debugging sessions.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text:
• Local: http://localhost:1421
  • Remote: https://rapidtriage.me

docs.title: Local Access
docs.text: No authentication required for localhost connections.

docs.title: Remote Access
docs.text:
Include JWT token in Authorization header: 

Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>

docs.title: GET /.identity
docs.text:
Returns server information and validates the connection.

Response: 

{
  "port": 1421,
  "name": "browser-tools-server",
  "version": "1.2.0",
  "signature": "mcp-browser-connector-24x7"
}

docs.title: GET /console-logs
docs.text:
Retrieves all captured console logs.

Query Parameters: - limit (optional): Maximum number of logs to return (default: 50) - level (optional): Filter by log level (log, warn, error, info)

Response: 

{
  "logs": [
    {
      "type": "console-log",
      "level": "info",
      "message": "Application initialized",
      "timestamp": 1704067200000,
      "source": "app.js:42"
    }
  ],
  "count": 1,
  "truncated": false
}

docs.title: GET /console-errors
docs.text:
Retrieves only console errors and exceptions.

Response: 

{
  "errors": [
    {
      "type": "console-error",
      "message": "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'x' of undefined",
      "stack": "at Object.<anonymous> (app.js:15:5)",
      "timestamp": 1704067200000
    }
  ],
  "count": 1
}

docs.title: GET /network-success
docs.text:
Retrieves successful network requests.

Query Parameters: - limit (optional): Maximum number of requests (default: 50) - method (optional): Filter by HTTP method

Response: 

{
  "requests": [
    {
      "url": "https://api.example.com/data",
      "method": "GET",
      "status": 200,
      "duration": 145,
      "size": 2048,
      "timestamp": 1704067200000,
      "requestHeaders": {},
      "responseHeaders": {}
    }
  ],
  "count": 1
}

docs.title: GET /network-errors
docs.text:
Retrieves failed network requests.

Response: 

{
  "errors": [
    {
      "url": "https://api.example.com/broken",
      "method": "POST",
      "status": 500,
      "error": "Internal Server Error",
      "timestamp": 1704067200000
    }

  "count": 1

All endpoints return consistent error responses:

docs.title: Error Codes
docs.text: Code Description INVALID_REQUEST Malformed or missing parameters NOT_FOUND Resource not found UNAUTHORIZED Authentication required FORBIDDEN Insufficient permissions INTERNAL_ERROR Server error RATE_LIMITED Too many requests

docs.text:
• Local: No rate limiting

docs.title: ws://localhost:1421/extension-ws
docs.text:
WebSocket connection for real-time data streaming.

Message Types: - heartbeat - Keep-alive - console-log - Console output - network-request - Network activity - screenshot-request - Screenshot trigger

docs.title: cURL Examples
docs.text:
# Get console logs
curl http://localhost:1421/console-logs

# Take screenshot
curl -X POST http://localhost:1421/capture-screenshot

# Run accessibility audit
curl -X POST http://localhost:1421/accessibility-audit \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"url": "https://example.com"}'

# Clear all logs
curl -X POST http://localhost:1421/wipelogs

docs.title: JavaScript Examples
docs.text:
// Fetch console logs
const response = await fetch('http://localhost:1421/console-logs');
const data = await response.json();
console.log(data.logs);

// Take screenshot
const screenshot = await fetch('http://localhost:1421/capture-screenshot', {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
  body: JSON.stringify({ fullPage: true })
});
const result = await screenshot.json();
console.log('Screenshot saved:', result.path);

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text: RapidTriageME is built with a modular, distributed architecture that enables real-time browser debugging through AI assistants.

docs.title: System Architecture
docs.text:
graph TB
    subgraph "Browser Environment"
        WP[Web Page]
        CE[Chrome Extension]
        DT[DevTools API]
        WP -->|Events| DT
        DT -->|Data| CE
    end

    subgraph "Local Environment"
        BS[Browser Connector<br/>:1421]
        MCP[MCP Server]
        CE -->|WebSocket| BS
        BS <-->|HTTP/REST| MCP
    end

    subgraph "Cloud Infrastructure"
        CF[Cloudflare Worker]
        KV[(KV Storage)]
        DO[Durable Objects]
        CF --> KV
        CF --> DO
    end

    subgraph "AI Integration"
        Claude[Claude]
        Cursor[Cursor IDE]
        ChatGPT[ChatGPT]
        MCP -->|MCP Protocol| Claude
        MCP -->|MCP Protocol| Cursor
        MCP -->|MCP Protocol| ChatGPT
    end

    BS -.->|Optional Remote| CF

docs.title: 1. Chrome Extension
docs.text:
• Purpose: Captures browser data through Chrome DevTools API
  • Technology: Vanilla JavaScript, Chrome Extensions Manifest V3
  • Key Features:
  • Console log capture
  • Network request monitoring
  • Error tracking
  • Screenshot capture
  • Element inspection

docs.title: 2. Browser Connector Server
docs.text:
• Purpose: Local server that aggregates and processes browser data
  • Port: 1421 (configurable)
  • Technology: Node.js, Express, WebSocket
  • Key Features:
  • WebSocket connection management
  • Data aggregation
  • Lighthouse audit integration
  • REST API endpoints

docs.title: 3. MCP Server
docs.text:
• Purpose: Bridges browser data to AI assistants
  • Protocol: Model Context Protocol (MCP)
  • Technology: TypeScript, MCP SDK
  • Tools Provided:
  • getConsoleLogs
  • getNetworkErrors
  • takeScreenshot
  • runAccessibilityAudit
  • runPerformanceAudit

docs.title: 4. Cloudflare Worker
docs.text:
• Purpose: Optional remote access and edge computing
  • Technology: Cloudflare Workers, Durable Objects
  • Features:
  • Global edge deployment
  • WebSocket support
  • KV storage for sessions
  • JWT authentication

docs.title: Local Debugging Flow
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant Browser
    participant Extension
    participant Connector
    participant MCP
    participant AI

    User->>Browser: Opens webpage
    Browser->>Extension: Page events
    Extension->>Connector: WebSocket (logs, errors)
    User->>AI: "Check console logs"
    AI->>MCP: Tool call
    MCP->>Connector: GET /console-logs
    Connector-->>MCP: Log data
    MCP-->>AI: Formatted response
    AI-->>User: Analysis

docs.title: Remote Debugging Flow
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant Browser
    participant Worker
    participant AI

    User->>Browser: Opens webpage
    Browser->>Worker: Send data (HTTPS)
    Worker->>Worker: Store in KV/DO
    User->>AI: "Debug remote session"
    AI->>Worker: Fetch data (SSE/REST)
    Worker-->>AI: Session data
    AI-->>User: Analysis

docs.title: WebSocket Protocol
docs.text:
• Extension ↔ Connector: Real-time bidirectional communication

  • console-log

docs.title: Authentication Layers
docs.text:
1. Local Access: No auth required (localhost only)
  2. Remote Access: JWT tokens for Cloudflare Worker
  3. MCP Access: Controlled by AI platform

docs.title: Data Protection
docs.text:
• Encryption: TLS for all remote connections
  • Isolation: Durable Objects for session isolation
  • Sanitization: Input validation and output encoding
  • Rate Limiting: Request throttling at edge

docs.title: Horizontal Scaling
docs.text:
• Stateless connector servers
  • Edge deployment via Cloudflare
  • Session affinity via Durable Objects

docs.title: Performance Optimizations
docs.text:

  • Connection pooling

docs.title: Chrome Extension
docs.text: The RapidTriageME Chrome Extension is the data collection layer that captures browser events, console logs, network requests, and errors.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The extension operates in the browser's privileged context, using Chrome's DevTools API to capture comprehensive debugging information.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
graph LR
    subgraph Chrome Browser
        WP[Web Page]
        CS[Content Script]
        BG[Background Script]
        DT[DevTools Panel]

        WP --> CS
        CS --> BG
        BG --> DT
        DT --> API[DevTools API]
    end

    DT -->|WebSocket| BC[Browser Connector :1421]

docs.title: 🔍 Data Capture
docs.text:
• Console Logs - All console.* methods
  • Errors - JavaScript exceptions and runtime errors
  • Network Requests - XHR and Fetch API calls
  • DOM Events - User interactions and mutations
  • Performance Metrics - Resource timing, paint events
  • Screenshots - On-demand viewport capture

docs.title: 🎛️ DevTools Panel
docs.text: Custom panel in Chrome DevTools providing: - Connection status indicator - Real-time log viewer - Settings configuration - Server discovery - Manual screenshot trigger

docs.title: 🔗 Auto-Discovery
docs.text: Automatic server discovery on ports 1421-1431: 1. Checks default port (1421) 2. Scans alternate ports 3. Validates server identity 4. Establishes WebSocket connection

docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/yarlisai/rapidtriage.git
cd rapidtriage/rapidtriage-extension

  2. Load in Chrome:

  3. Navigate to chrome://extensions/
  4. Enable "Developer mode"
  5. Click "Load unpacked"
  6. Select the extension directory

docs.title: Message Protocol
docs.text:
The extension communicates via WebSocket with these message types:

// Console log message
{
  type: "console-log",
  level: "info",
  message: "Application started",
  timestamp: 1704067200000
}

// Network request
{
  type: "network-request", 
  url: "https://api.example.com",
  method: "GET",
  status: 200,
  duration: 145
}

// Error message
{
  type: "console-error",
  message: "Uncaught TypeError",
  stack: "at app.js:42",
  timestamp: 1704067200000
}

docs.title: WebSocket Events
docs.text:
// Connection established
ws.onopen = () => {
  console.log('Connected to server');
};

// Message received
ws.onmessage = (event) => {
  const message = JSON.parse(event.data);
  handleServerMessage(message);
};

// Connection closed
ws.onclose = () => {
  console.log('Disconnected from server');
  attemptReconnect();
};

docs.title: Optimization Strategies
docs.text:
• Throttling - Limits message frequency
  • Batching - Groups multiple events
  • Compression - Reduces payload size
  • Filtering - Excludes noise
  • Sampling - Statistical sampling for high-volume

docs.title: Resource Usage
docs.text:
Typical resource consumption:

Metric Value Memory ~10-20 MB CPU <1% idle, 2-5% active Network ~1-10 KB/s Storage <1 MB

docs.title: Permissions Model
docs.text:
• Host Permissions - Limited to localhost
  • Content Security Policy - Strict CSP
  • Data Sanitization - XSS prevention
  • No External Requests - Local only

docs.title: Data Privacy
docs.text:
• No data leaves localhost by default
  • No analytics or tracking
  • No persistent storage of sensitive data
  • User-controlled data clearing

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Extension not loading
  • Check Developer mode is enabled
  • Verify manifest.json is valid
  • Check for console errors
Not connecting to server
  • Verify server is running on port 1421
  • Check firewall settings
  • Try manual connection test
No data captured
  • Refresh the page after loading extension
  • Check DevTools is open
  • Verify debugger is attached

docs.title: Debug Commands
docs.text:
Run in extension console:

// Check connection status
chrome.runtime.sendMessage({type: 'GET_STATUS'});

// Force reconnect
chrome.runtime.sendMessage({type: 'RECONNECT'});

// Clear all data
chrome.runtime.sendMessage({type: 'CLEAR_DATA'});

docs.title: Chrome Extension APIs Used
docs.text:
• chrome.debugger - Attach to tabs
  • chrome.devtools - Create panel
  • chrome.runtime - Message passing
  • chrome.storage - Settings persistence
  • chrome.tabs - Tab management

docs.title: Custom Events
docs.text:
The extension emits these events:

// Server connected
window.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('rapidtriage:connected'));

// Data captured
window.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('rapidtriage:data', {
  detail: { type: 'console-log', data: {...} }
}));

// Error occurred
window.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('rapidtriage:error', {
  detail: { message: 'Connection failed' }
}));

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Server not starting?

Make sure port 1421 is not in use: 

lsof -i :1421
# Kill any process using the port
kill -9 <PID>

Extension not connecting?
  1. Check the server is running
  2. Reload the extension
  3. Refresh the browser tab
  4. Check DevTools console for errors
AI not receiving data?

Verify MCP configuration: 

# Test MCP server directly
npx @yarlisai/rapidtriage-mcp

Need help? Check our troubleshooting guide or open an issue.
